summary: This is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) dated July 24, 2020, containing a list of press clips. The clips reference a judge's ruling to unseal records in a defamation case involving Ghislaine Maxwell and a political video targeting Donald Trump for his comments about Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: Subject of defamation case and political commentary
persons.context: Mentioned in press clips regarding a judge ruling to unseal records in her defamation case and as the subject of comments by Donald Trump targeted in a political video.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Referenced in a press clip about a political video released by the Lincoln Project targeting his comments regarding Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Trump's comments about Maxwell are the subject of a political attack video, indicating a public association discussed in media.

events.title: Judge rules to unseal Maxwell defamation case records
events.description: A judge rules to unseal records in a defamation case involving Ghislaine Maxwell, as reported by ABC News.

events.title: Lincoln Project releases video targeting Trump's Maxwell comments
events.description: The Lincoln Project releases a new political video targeting Donald Trump for his comments about Ghislaine Maxwell, as reported by The Hill.

keyFacts: On July 24, 2020, a judge ruled to unseal records in a defamation case involving Ghislaine Maxwell.
The Lincoln Project released a political video on July 24, 2020, targeting Donald Trump for his comments about Ghislaine Maxwell.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was circulating these press clips internally.
The document shows ongoing media and political attention surrounding Ghislaine Maxwell in July 2020.
